definition: to recoil/to draw back/to fall back/to retreat
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw

sentences.english: No retreat is allowed, only advance.
Back off - pushy persistence will not get you to first base.
sentences.chinese: 后退一步，坚持不一定让你成为第一人选。

sentences.english: The horse shied at the snake on the road.
sentences.chinese: 那马看到路上的蛇吓得直往后退。

sentences.english: ATTENDANT: Yes, I can give you regular unleaded. But you have to back up the car a little.
sentences.chinese: 那我给你加一般无铅汽油，但是你要把车后退一点。

sentences.english: The children drew back from the dog when it barked at them.
sentences.chinese: 那只狗朝孩子们叫，他们就往后退。

sentences.english: I am a slow walker, but I never walk backwards.
sentences.chinese: 缫我走得很慢，但是我从来不会后退。

sentences.english: Confronted by the angry crowd the police retreated.
sentences.chinese: 面对愤怒的人群，警察后退了。

sentences.english: In order to develop language, Humphrey says humans had to take a step backward.
sentences.chinese: 为了发展语言，修佛瑞表示，人类必须向后退一步。

sentences.english: Stops playing the movie, and rewinds it to the beginning.
sentences.chinese: 停止播放影片，并后退到开始处。

sentences.english: This danger was a great one, but the peril of retreating was still greater.
sentences.chinese: 这一危险很大，但后退的危险则更大。

sentences.english: He looked at her step backwards, he can not catch the remotest corners of the globe to.
sentences.chinese: 他看着她一步步向后退，退到他抓不到的天涯海角。

sentences.english: With the retreat of this boundary the cohesive bonds gradually yield.
sentences.chinese: 随着这种边界的后退，凝聚性结合逐渐屈服。

sentences.english: McDull law of six, we can move forward slowly, but we can not retreat.
sentences.chinese: 麦兜定律六，我们可以慢慢向前走，但绝对不能后退。

sentences.english: At the moment of victory, we regress.
sentences.chinese: 在胜利的时刻，我们后退了。

sentences.english: He shrank back, tightly with the money in the pocket.
sentences.chinese: 老爹朝后退着，紧紧护着口袋里的钱。

sentences.english: They are reverting toward the average .
sentences.chinese: 他们正向平均水平后退。

definition: to get out of the way
to evade/to dodge (out of the way)
to fall back/to go in reverse
to stay out of (hot water, trouble, awkward situation etc)/to avoid (sb)
to jump out of the way
